page.title: 05VEGETATION
page.content: Ribbons of the{natural deciduous {woodland}which once covered the area remain along the valley floors. South Wood for example contains a mixture of {oak, ash, beech}and{sycamore}trees along with creeping plants such as{ivy Faster growing{coniferous trees are found in several{mixed plantations to the North of the area. Cransdown Plantation (the largest) is run by the {Forestry Commission. The{scrubland}vegetation on Cadson Bury was found to include: {bracken, brambles, tormentil, rosebay {willowherb, heather, thistle}and {foxglove. }Also{cut-leaved germander and a{lady orchid}which are rare in Britain. Many other flowering plants are found in the{meadows}for pasture and } {hedgerows}which man has introduced to the area.
